document_data.name: Calmarr
document_data.basicrefs: {{cite web| url = https://web.archive.org/web/20240501054732/http://www.candlekeep.com/library/articles/sse/sse_050607-04.htm| title = So Saith Ed May â€“ Jul 2004| accessdate = 25-11-2021| date = 1-5-2024}}
document_data.mainbody: '''Calmarr''' or '''ornsoelaun''' was a variety of [[cheese]], staple on the tables of [[Turmish]] in the [[Vilhon Reach]].
document_data.Description: Calmarr was a soft and crumbly variety of cheese, veined with [[chives]] and other types of [[herb]]s. These cheeses were locally made across Turmish and served as a part of daily meal routine as cheese platters alongside brown [[nutbread]]s, [[onion and chive soup]]s, meats, and [[spice]]d greens.
